Sadio Mané's reaction to meeting his teammate's twin on the opposing team

Football Dua Lipa · 26/08/2023

﻿Al-Nassr star Sadio Mane had a hilarious reaction after shaking hands with Al-Fateh's Qassem Lajami, the twin brother of the former's teammate, Ali Lajami.

Al-Alami were set to face Al-Fateh in the Saudi Pro League at the Prince Abdullah Bin Jalawi Stadium today (August 25). Sadio Mane and co. will be looking to get back to winning ways after suffering back-to-back defeats against Al-Ettifaq and Al-Taawoun to start their season.

Before the game began, when the two teams were shaking hands, Sadio Mane had a humorous experience. When the 31-year-old shook Qassem Lajami of Al Fateh's hand, Mane hilariously made a quick flip around and wore a bewildered expression. This was because Mane's Al-Nassr colleague, Ali, is Qassem's identical sibling.

Watch the complete video down below:

At halftime, Al-Nassr is leading Al-Fateh 2-0. The Knights of Najd now hold a sizable advantage thanks to goals from Mane and Cristiano Ronaldo.

Why did Sadio Mane decide to join Al-Nassr?

On August 1, Sadio Mane startled the football community by joining Saudi Pro League team Al-Nassr. The Senegal captain had initially expressed a desire to stay with Bayern Munich, but after a lackluster debut season, the Bavarians made it apparent that he had no place in their team.

.

The 31-year-old said that Roberto Firmino and Fabinho, two former Liverpool teammates, first tried to persuade him to join Al-Ahli and Al-Ittihad, but he ultimately chose to join Cristiano Ronaldo's Al-Nassr.

He gave his mum credit for facilitating his decision to relocate to Saudi Arabia. Through The National News, he stated:

Since I got the chance, I spoke to my family, who were naturally the happiest because it is a Muslim nation. I was strongly encouraged to go by my mother. It was not difficult because it is essential to my faith, and my mother, who is Muslim like me, was the first to vote for me to come here. We have a promising future ahead of us, so I'm happy to be a part of this project and help it move forward.

Mane acknowledged that it was difficult to pass up the opportunity to play alongside Cristiano Ronaldo:

"I think you can see how quickly everything moves for me because he [Ronaldo] is undoubtedly one of the best players in history, if not the best. That was simple for me because he makes things simpler for me. To make the club a true success, I am really pleased to start the league with all these youngsters, including (Brazil midfielder) Talisca. They are all really outstanding players.

With two goals in his first three games for Al-Nassr, Sadio Mane has had a strong start. He triumphed in the Arab Club Champions Cup as well.
